Sentencas: The design of new functional materials for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is of paramount importance in terms of achieving a trade-off between their performance, efficiency and long-term stability.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: In the present work, synthesised Sn-substituted BaCeO3 materials are characterised as new proton-conducting electrolyte derivatives.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-8 compositions (x = 0.3, 0.4 and 0.5) are formed by heavily doping a barium cerate ceramic with tin for increased chemical stability and ytterbium to provide proton transport.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: The transport properties of these compositions are comprehensively studied across a wide range of temperatures (200-900 degrees C), oxygen partial pressures (10- 18-0.21 atm) and water vapour partial pressures (from 0.001 to 0.1 atm).
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: Sn-doping is observed to result in a deterioration of both bulk and grain boundary conductivities of the corresponding ceramic materials due to crystallochemical and microstructural factors.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: At the same time, stability with respect to chemical interaction with H2O and CO2 is improved compared with Sn-free cerates.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport

Sentencas: The obtained results suggest that the co-doping of BaCeO3 with tin and ytterbium is a promising approach to the design of proton-conducting electrolytes having good ionic conductivity coupled with high chemical stability.
Titulo: Heavily Sn-doped barium cerates BaCe0.8-xSnxYb0.2O3-δ: Correlations between composition and ionic transport
